resources.string: Say \"digits\", \"forecast\" or \"phones\" to choose the grammar, language model or phonetic decoder example.
To try recognition of digits: say something like \"one two three four five\".
To try recognition of a weather forecast like \"sunny spells on Wednesday\".
To try phonetic recognition say anything.
When the audio stops, say a command.

On the floor in front of you the fallen oil painting lies face-down. On the wall there is a faded square where it used to hang with a bent nail hanging askew from its hole. A small, but ornate side table holds up a ceramic pot filled with the remains of a plant that rotted long, long ago.
It is an oil painting. It depicts an unusual and gruesome scene in which a giant bunny rabbit in a torchlit cave, glares sinisterly over a boiling vat -- out from which sticks a pair of human legs.

You see the back of the frame. A hanging wire is attached. You flip it over to see the artist’s handiwork. It depicts an unusual and gruesome scene in which a giant bunny rabbit in a torchlit cave, glares sinisterly over a boiling vat -- out from which sticks a pair of human legs.
In the gap between the rabbit’s fluffy white head and neck you see handwritten letters. Hidden inside this painting is a note of some sort.
The nail is rusty and bent. Strange, though, that it gave in to gravity at the same time you appeared.
